Dialog.Body:
joins the room
leaves the room
joins the room
joins the room
hello
hello
joins the room
hello
:)
hi there
hello, maria
hello everyone:)
I hope the others didn't forget about this meeting
Cristina has some problems with connecting to the meeting
we should wait some moments :)
how about matei?
I personally don't know anything about Matei; actually, he hasn't confirmed his participation
actually, he did
joins the room
I think he forgot to add the other users at his reply
hello, cristina
hello
hello
finally worked :)
can anyone call matei to remaind him about this meeting?
let's wait for tem more minutes, maybe matei will show up
I've emailed him. don;t know if it works
i have an organizatorical question about this second chat...
sure, go ahead
as far as i've understood we should discuss this:"You are in the board of decisions of a company that plans to use collaborative technologies for its activities"
right?
i understood the same thing
me too
so
ok... so what's the difference between chats 1,2,3,45 and 6 and 7...
in the emails chats 6 and 7 were called control groups... what is that meaning?
good question?
I do not think it is our concern
joins the room
hello Matei
maybe it's not... but i'm curious...:D
hello
ohhh matei is here
now we can start
sorry for the delay: java problems
:)
so we are going to talk about what Maria said
noe that the board members are all here, should we start?
* now that
yes, it's kind of a deja vu, we still have to praise/defend our solution
we can propose more than one solution
so we have to defend our solution or not ?
in the last chat we've conclusionated that there isn't a tool good for everything... every tool has his up sides :)
I do not think we have to defend them
k
sure
so what kind of company we have?
Exactly, and now we will have to expand that
guys, to simplify things, say we are a software developping company
I do not think it is relevant, but I believe we should have something IT related
suppose we work in a multinational company on a software project
Ok then, now let's decide upon the actions we will have to consider for the collaboration
ok so we need to talk with persons far far away:P
how could we enhance collaboration between team members and between the company and client? sounds ok?
First of all, we must be working on a project
sound fine:)
we need means to stay in touch and communicate changes we make
how we comunicate with clients ? we have to offer the product through a website ?
Let's assume the team is not at their first project
and we need a platform to connect all our actions
source versioning can cover this, in part
first of all, we should communicate to our team
source versioning for our code, you mean?
yes, everybody has to write a message with the changes they've made
I personally think the first thing we do is create a repository for the team
in this repository we put general info
but that's far from covering every aspect of the process
such as coding practices
so we make a wiki
so suppose we have the email for the communication... this is a slow solution and not very attractive... now let's see how we can improve that:P
but who will do it? who decides that? and how
team members task etc
I believe wikis are a good tool for creating a information hub
if we use mail
yes we do, but we don't start with that unless we have already decided what to write in it
we copy info
disperse ir
no no
you got me all wrong
I think that for an it company a wiki for storing the information (how to install this and that or how to create something) is a good idea
and not only that
My opinion is that we shall start with a chat
info about where SRD are located
yes...
yes, that's true. Still what do we do for live communication, wikis aren't suitable
so wiki is a usefull tool
of course
but we must have a common trunk of knowledge
yes, that is true
we keep track of support information (documentation)
in a wiki
i think that firs we have in the developing stage to use chat and wiki, and for the promoting stage forum and blogs
good point
first of all we should know what each parson is doing and which are each's responsibilities
for that we need a wiki
but to decide we need a wiki, we shall use the chat
for real time communication we could use the chats (whith or wthout video)
that is true
Ok then, now we know each person's responsabilities
we use chats to communicate between developers
and developers and client?
i think we should consider google wave as a middleware between chat and wiki
also chats can be used during writing the wikis
would that be suitable?
hmm
That is needed in order to controll the information
i do not know
I see google wave more suited for micro tasks
such as developping a certain part of the software
theoreticaly all good so far...chat+wiki = good work... but what about employes?
certain features
we can have quick, short conversations in chat and conferences in wave, and then take the relevant conclusions to wiki
we should offer them a good emviroment
yes
I think waves should be the form of our project, meaning that we should keep all collaborations inside waves
and we sould now some thiings about them
so i prupose a blog
for each person
where they can present themsevs
I would only use blogs for marketing and promoting the final product
developpers' blogs?
i think it will be confusing. One blog per product is better
so blogs for marketing :)
yes :)
companies really use them
for personal information and know their skills to know who to ask what
moreover, i would use forums for soluting problems
Cristina suggested somethiong interesting
cristina, what do you think about that?
well thing about your company is very big and managers are hireing ppl every month you should be able to know something about those persons
i was thinking the same thing. Forums for feedback and bug reports
and how to solve certain problems
yes, as I said before
if i have a problem on low level i shoul know not to ask the one that knows web development
I bet online interviews are often the only choice. Google wave could prove a good solution
Cristina, since you're responsible for forums,could you tell us another option?
google waves is also good for sharing code or documents
so you prupose GW for online interviews?
and keeping track of all stages
Not the best, but for quick updates, yes
online interviews? is that possible?
keeping track of changes is something GW seems to have been created for
maybe interviews with persons in other countries?
It seems the best solution: you can upload photos of projects, charts
also if we hire someone new, he watches the GW flow of develop
Can waves offer more features than live chat?
he catches uo fast this way
live chat is good for conversation, but it lacks the ability to embed resources
good ideea, indeed
I never used waves for that
i guess the pream,ble could be made on chat and the the chosen candidates can have a more elaborate conference on wave
and the interviewers could keep better track on that
we can ofer more information to potential developer by using a forum and ask for solution to problemes that aprear in the developing stage
it's better structured
and can ofer some prizes for diferent solutions
so we should use wave for interviews and for more tehical meetings...
cool, but whom do we ask for solutions?
I want to ask your opinion on Office Live for collaboration
what is this?
I never used it
a client should never know the weekness of our sistem:D
what technology does it build upon?
we should hava a different wave for clients
collaborative editing of documents/spreadsheets
i don't to potential developer, people with a lot of free time and interested in the project :)
but on the support offered by using Office Offline
how collaborative... like google docs?
Windows technology then?
hey, lucian, i think that we should write all our documents on wikis(exp. SRS,SDD, etc), what is your oppinion?
Microsoft proprietary?
well, wikis are good for collaboration
yes windows technology, similar to google docs
someone starts treh structure of SDD
others fill in
excellent
if we need to store a project we should use SVN...
google docs rule :), but we can use wikis in the same purpose
I propose mercurial for source versioning
but with 5 people writing in the same time i don't think is a good idea
you are refering to the code itself
that is why I believe wikis are making a good comboination with chat
it's distributed, meaning every member has his own offline repo that they can sync with the main server
we should stik on wikis
You write the wiki together and decide each person's role and contribution in the chat
google docs has a nice feature ...you can chat while editing
good point
are roles implemented in wikis?
this office stuff is a good collaborative solution but o don't think is for our company....
I believe there are wikis havig the same feature
there are professional wikis
no it's not, because we have wikis
they offer blogging capabilities
who?
Confluence and social text
the drawback is the license, but it has nice integration with other microsoft products like email
oh...you didn't link to your line
Maria, what would you use blogs for, except for promoting?
Confluence and Social text are 2 wiki based applications: they are centralised solutions, some kind of pror GW
in a company we will have pple for every little task: a document writer, a database admin, a grafical designer etc... each person writes in the wiki what he considers important... i don't this writting collaborative documents while chatting is somenthing we trully need
cool, i should try them
*proto GW
good point: what tool is best for diagrams and drawing
as i was sayng... I would want that all the employees to have theyr space....
for solution to diferent problems that may apear installing on diferent OS we should use forums
yahoo messenger has the doodle imvironment but it's not professional
but thay are part of the same company so everyting should be connected
Visio
concert chat has the whiteboard
I would like for everyone in the company to have a blog where they can present themselves...
so office live has its use after all
you can do a lot of cool stuff around here
This makes the experience more pleasent
if it is a Microsoft solution, we should better start preparing some moey
might be interesting if there are no team buildings :)
i think that we are looking for free solutions
:)
even with team buildings
haha, it wouldn't have crossed my mind, although we're using it right now :)
there are also a lot of collaborative whiteboards available online...and free
a team building is for a small group
would you mind giving some examples?
This ideea is for all the company
if it is a big company
very well put
a facebook more related to tech
I like the idea
we cannot make team buildings for all the ppl from all the countries or all around the countrie
we make the online
:)
we can assume there is a yearly summit
which needs planning
so now we have blogs to get to know us better, wikis to centralise info, GW to manage project development
Many companies use information from their employees' facebook accounts
forums as well
how do we communicate to clients?
team building are rare and if the company hires 3 persons... how would everyone else know about the new arivels?
indeed, good point
forum
for diferent problems and solution to them
we can also make a wiki
this is how an interface looks like
for clients we can have a blog
how would you, client, want it changes
for general informations about the product
where periodically update the informations
but how do they post input?
i agree, blogs are best for announcements
say they llike to change one of our tables etc
they can be followed by means of rss feeds
yes, blogs are ideal for communication, but not problem solluting
for that we have forums
they post comments tot the blog post or in the forum
yes rss feed is good, mailing lists also...
posting does not allow modifying text
blogs are good jus for offering informations to clients
forums are good internaly for problen solving
in a wiki they could edit what we offer them
clients?
yes
google wave is the best when it comes to editing previous posts
yes but if 200 people modify
i wouldn't use wikis for that, but it might be interesting
why we would want clients to modify our offer?
200 clients?
and also is the spam problem
company wiki shouldn't be open for public editing
everibody can make changes on wiki if you let them
spam? we can restrict editing rights straightforward
I agree, wikis are not for comunicating and establishing relations
they are actually used this way in bussiness :)
i igree too...
wikis are for howtos and technical details/documentation
really? i didn't know
wikis forums and chats sould be used internally
off course, nobody would chat with clients
the professional solutions I mentioned are used this way
maybe only for real time tech support
forums i think should be opened to clients
yes, problems come from clients too
if we developped GW, client could indicate what we needed to change
i've seen companies using the pair (chat, forum) for sollutions
like bug ticketing or smth like?
bug signaling
yes, that is a usage
oh sory:D
sounds very helpful
so for the promoting and testing part we user blog and forums ?
what do you mean, develop google wave?
but for this we could have throu email an error report...
what for?
or any new product that needs feedback from many people
for bug reporting...
waves is a good tool for feedback, and so are blogs
automated error reporting is done through email best
I actually wanted to say that GW was released to the public to be tested
like when the application crashes and asks the user to submit the info
:))
cool
yes, but that's over, it's a stable release now
this is what i was thinking of ....
let's hope our fictional application won't crash
so let's conlusionate....
I agree
shall we state the usage for each tool or consider the utilities forst?
it's good to be optimistic, but then again be pragmatic and implement error handling
I know...but it's fictional :0
usages and the utilities
who wants to start?
we have - quick communication: chat
I believe chat is a good tool for any short conversation
conferences and design collaboration: wave
and brainstorming
wikis for sdd srs etc.
waves is also good for keeping track of progress
blogs for presentation to customer
blogs for customer announcements and news
yes, publicity
actually, wikis for any official document or todo list
forums for support
nice
is that all?
i think so
email for automated bug reporting
and i stand for my ideea that every employee shoud have his personal blog so that every other employee to know something more than just his name....
that's about all I could remember :)
could we find a replacement for email?
since it is not on the list
maybe chat for real-time and forum elsewhere?
might get crowded and confusing, but sure, everybody's free to have a blog outside the development process
it's a good tool
that could contribute to company promotion
Maria has a point, in my opiniion
I also agree, it's just like facebook
think why team building were created
all the team knows the tech abilities/ strong points of each meber
so that employees should know each other better and work better
this is what blogs offers also
a better understanding of the other employee
yes, we should use them for this reason
of course, but the question is: should this be officially included in the development process?
but i believe we should have a format
wikis would have a link tp each memeber's page
this in order not to get too much information
each blog is like a wiki page, ok
?
good point, i agree with that
simple to create
I don't know ehat are you really mean... are team buildings included?
I think he refferd to blogs
it shouldn't obly the employee, but it is a nice thig to have for those who want to post info about themselves
yes indeed
team building should be only during face to face meeting
meetings
but blogs are an interesting replacement when lacking that
i will leave early tonight as i have to catch the last subway train to home :)
thank you for your time, Matei
i think that we covered every aspect
i thing every person should have a blog page in wich he/she can write basic information like a picture/name/years i dunno... and if they want more ellaborate informations like what hobbys they have and so on
my pleasure, and confratulations to all for the collaborative conference
leaves the room
so, any need we should address?
any other problem?
me too
nope
we should end here
no, i thing it's all crear
that's that then :)
*clear
ok then, thank you for the collaboration
thank you, all
bye
leaves the room
I will take care of everything from now on
bye
bye bye
leaves the room
thanks for that
bye bye
leaves the room
leaves the room 131
